column1: Then the man took off his hat and walked away
column2: and Philip and his sister went home. She seemed different
column4: and he was sent to bed a little earlier than usual
column5: but he could not go to sleep for a long time
column6: because he heard the front-door bell ring and afterwards a man's voice and Helen's going on and on in the little drawing-room under the room which was his bedroom. He went to sleep at last
column7: and when he woke up in the morning it was raining
column8: and the sky was grey and miserable. He lost his collar-stud
column9: he tore one of his stockings as he pulled it on
column10: he pinched his finger in the door
column13: and the mug was broken and the water went into his boots. There are mornings
column15: when things happen like that. This was one of them.
